page.title: 02LOWER HARDRES AREA-BUILDINGS
page.content: Most of the houses are situated along the B2068 road and the lane leading to the village hall, school and Lower Hardres church. At this junction is the Granville Inn and Forge. In the lane is the entrance to Street End Place a 1500 acre estate which accommdates the cricket ground and pavilion. Opposite the school is a small green with seat and stone cross bearing names of those who lost their lives in the 1914-18 and 1939-45 wars. Near the church are boarding kennels for cats. The timbered Old Farmhouse once a medieval Hall House is the oldest building in the village. To the north on the B2068 opposite a War Memorial and seat is a lane leading to Nackington Church and farm. Further on are Police Traffic Offices, a Boys' Grammar School and a Private Hospital, all 20th century builings.
